etymology.description: Depicts a weaving tool or a carrying pole, uncertain origins -> representation as the ninth heavenly stem
etymology.interpretation: While the precise original pictogram for 壬(壬) (rén, "ninth heavenly stem") is unclear, its forms suggest instrumental or structural elements such as a tool or pole. These interpretations align with its later symbolic use as one of the ten heavenly stems in the Chinese calendrical system.

examples.chinese: 壬代表天干第九位(壬代表天干第九位)。
examples.pinyin: Rén dàibiǎo tiāngān dì jiǔ wèi.
examples.english: Rén represents the ninth heavenly stem.

examples.chinese: 在干支纪年中(在干支紀年中)，壬年被认为是关键年份(壬年被認爲是關鍵年份)。
examples.pinyin: Zài gānzhī jìnián zhōng, rén nián bèi rènwéi shì guānjiàn niánfèn.
examples.english: In the sexagenary cycle, the year designated by Rén is considered a key year.

examples.chinese: 古人以壬水象征变化(古人以壬水象徵變化)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ rén yǐ rén shuǐ xiàngzhēng biànhuà.
examples.english: Ancient scholars used the element Rén water to symbolize change.
